thread.title: Players arrive in camp ahead of Black Stars friendly against Canada
thread.title_full: Players arrive in camp ahead of Black Stars friendly against Canada

title: Players arrive in camp ahead of Black Stars friendly against Canada
text:
11:42 CET Players arrive in camp ahead of Black Stars friendly against Canada By Ghana FA 
The Black Stars will begin training on Friday evening as players have started arriving for next week's international friendly against Canada in Washington, USA. 
Europe based players such as Italy-based duo of Afriyie Acquah and Alfred Duncan are currently in camp as well as goalkeeper Razak Brimah. 
Germany-based Phil Ofosu-Ayeh, who had received his debut call up into the national team has also arrived in the team's base in Washington. 
A local contingent which includes Black Stars management committee chairman George Afriyie, assistant coach Maxwell Konadu, goalkeeper Fatau Dauda and other officials also joined the team on Friday ahead of Tuesday's friendly. 
Black Stars Coach Avram Grant has already been in the United States where he has been scouting ahead of the game. 
Also in camp are US- based Harrison Afful and Middlesbrough winger Albert Adomah. 
Other players are expected to join the team's camp on Friday.
